WTPot Widget Demo

How to Use

Include the WTPot script in your HTML:

<script src="https://your-domain.com/wtpot.umd.js"></script>

Method 1: Add via data attributes

<div id="payment-container"></div>
<script 
  data-wtpot 
  data-container="payment-container"
  data-amounts="[49.99, 99.99, 149.99]"
  data-currency="USD"
  src="https://your-domain.com/wtpot.umd.js">
</script>

Method 2: Initialize programmatically

<div id="payment-container"></div>
<script src="https://your-domain.com/wtpot.umd.js"></script>
<script>
  WTPot.init({
    containerId: "payment-container",
    amounts: [49.99, 99.99, 149.99],
    currency: "USD",
    // Optional styling
    colors: {
      primary: "#3B82F6",
      secondary: "#60A5FA"
    }
  });
</script>

Using with subscription plans:

<script>
  WTPot.init({
    containerId: "payment-container",
    subscriptionPlans: [
      {
        id: "basic",
        name: "Basic Plan",
        description: "For individuals",
        price: 9.99,
        priceOptions: [7.99, 8.99, 9.99, 10.99],
        interval: "monthly"
      },
      {
        id: "pro",
        name: "Pro Plan",
        description: "For professionals",
        price: 19.99,
        priceOptions: [17.99, 19.99, 21.99, 23.99],
        interval: "monthly"
      }
    ],
    currency: "USD"
  });
</script>
